page.title: 11BRONZE AGE BURIAL GROUND
page.content: A retired librarian came and took us on a visit to the place where the {coffins}of the{Bronze Age}were found. The{burial ground}has been there for more than{2000 years.}The{coffins}were found{100 years ago. As we reached the place we passed the {Bishop's Burn}and we saw a{Baggie {Minnow}which is a{small fish.}We were then taken across the road to the {special school,}where we walked along and he told us in times gone by that the{bark of the Silver Birch tree}was used to make{parchment}for writing on. He pointed out the spot where the {Codger's well}had been.{Codgers}were people who went round with a{horse {and cart}and went to{farms to buy hens {and ducks.}This was because the {farmer's wife}couldn't go to{market}to sell them there.
